website_summaries.verdict: The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-RX1R II puts an incredible high-resolution full-frame image sensor and fixed lens into a form factor that's almost pocket friendly.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small camera, and too small for my XXL hands...
customer_reviews.text: A camera I'd wanted for years. Finally got one, but returned it the next week. Simply too small for my XXL-glove size hands to work the controls comfortably or casually. I probably should have figured that out before I bought it, but the heart wants what it wants... Oh well. The A7 series cameras are still excellent and work very well for me. My A7RII is my mainstay.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations, Killer Camera
customer_reviews.text: Took this to a concert that started in daylight and finished in the dark. I was 10 feet from the stage. You can crop aggressively if need be. Colors are great right out of camera, very little done in post. Of course for concerts having no zoom will not be good when I am 200 feet away. Easy to use, well made and the autofocus is much quicker than expected. I could not be happier. Perceived value does cover the high price tag.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Seaberry

customer_reviews.title: Quality and form factor
customer_reviews.text: Going on two years as my daily driver. Image quality is superb. Form factor took a bit to learn but now is second nature (ditto with menu system). Love the 35mm POV. I can't imaging a more perfect camera for capturing day to day life. I still aim to own an A7 for more long-reach stuff but for travel, family, and just walk-around, the RX1R II is worth its price.
customer_reviews.author: JP-Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing camera. I also have a Canon 5D
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing camera. I also have a Canon 5D, Nikon D810 and a Hasselblad 500CM. This camera is my favorite. Size, features and image quality is exceptional. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Rivera

customer_reviews.title: big flop
customer_reviews.text: Researched this camera and bought it finally and what a flop! Heavy and hard to handle to start with and not a single picture we took in night or evening came right; they are all blurry even while using a steady shot. I had a NEX 7 before and that was a beauty but this is a disgrace to Sony Camera lineup.
customer_reviews.author: booboo

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I took it on my hiking trip to New Zealand, It is light and takes amazing photos. I cannot imagine taking my regular DSLR camera and walking with additional 10K on my back and climbing. I love the internal WIFI and connection to my phone. Images are great, crips and with 42 mega pixels, the details are stunning. I also like the fixed lens. Although, not a good wildlife camera, I concentrated on the landscape, still took a few good photos. very happy with the the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mojgan A.

customer_reviews.text: Incredibly good cam when it comes to resolution and color. The menu is - as usual with sony - very complicated.

customer_reviews.title: this is perhaps the best camera ever made
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, this is perhaps the best camera ever made. Yes, it's that good. The lens is amazingly sharp and paired with this monster 42mp sensor, you are entering into medium format territory for a fraction of the cost. Highly versatile, this camera caters to the photographer seeking the best possible results at 35mm.

customer_reviews.title: The battery life is abysmal.  That is this camera's greatest flaw.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is abysmal. That is the main problem. Stunningly short-lived. Using primarily the EVF and conscientiously turning off the camera between anticipated shots (due to the poor battery life), one seems to get 100 to 120 shots over a few hours of a day. If you are traveling, sight-seeing, shooting regularly and ever use burst mode, you will need several batteries per day. It's very frustrating, especially coming from larger systems with much longer-lived battery lives. On the other hand, the image quality produced by this camera is quite nice. It really stands out. The EVF works well and the focusing system is much improved compared to the first generation RX1R.
customer_reviews.author: George Shaw

customer_reviews.title: work in progress
customer_reviews.text: Optics is average. No rival to Sigma or Canon glass. F2.0 is barely adequate. I was having to accept higher ISOs in lower light situations which on a full frame look decent up to 3200. Battery life is less than pathetic. I use wi-fi SD card which sends pics to my Mac as soon as they are taken and this thing overheats and shuts down. I barely get 15 mins of uninterrupted use from a a single charge. Slippery. Impossible to hold without some type of grip or two-handed handling. Basically this is a pocketable $4K piece of work in progress.
customer_reviews.author: WOLFSON

customer_reviews.title: Big Deal
customer_reviews.text: Too big to put in your pocket. The macro is not outstanding for such an expensive single lense camera. Ended up giving it back as did not think it was worth it. Has a lot of bells and whistles that can take you a long time to master if and when you are dedicated to reading the limited instructions given.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent image quality on the go
customer_reviews.text: Excellent image quality on the go. I ve sold my huge DSLR and purchase this small one at a good price point. It turns out that I finally have a camera that really can be with me everywhere and everyday. I like hiking with it. And I can shoot more photos because it's just so convenient and lightweight to carry. Classic lens, tip-top sensor, beautiful EVF, and wifi. All of these makes it great to use. I also pair with some accessories, such as thumb grip, release button, batteries and chargers, hood, filters, tripod, and a flash. Trying to make the most out of it.

customer_reviews.title: Just ignore the negative reviews and buy this amazing camera. Take it from me
customer_reviews.text: Just ignore the negative reviews and buy this amazing camera. Take it from me, I am a pro photographer who have had every major brand from Canon to Fuji, yes even Leica. A true photographer simply can NOT complain about this marvel of engineering. If you can not get great results/photographs from this camera, your skills are questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Anime

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera. I have rented the Rx1R M1 and ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera. I have rented the Rx1R M1 and M2 and just recently bought the latest version. Its a fantastic camera - great image quality, bokeh, very compact for traveling. Its absolutely best in class. The battery issues have been highlighted before but carrying 1/2 spare batteries is no big deal to me as they are cheap. I used to own a Leica Q which I resold and I feel the Rx1R2 is better in many ways most notably in Dynamic Range and low light. But they are neck and neck in most aspects - in size and price the Sony wins out as well.
customer_reviews.author: Abiraman Subramanian
